public static double calculateVariance(double aSumOfValues,
                                       double aSumOfSquaredValues,
                                       int aValuesCount)
Parameters:
aSumOfValues - The sum of all values in a sample set
aSumOfSquaredValues - The sum of all squared values, in a sample set
aValuesCount - The number of values in the sample set
Returns:
The sample set's variance

makeAssumingGeometricChanges

public static SampleSet makeAssumingGeometricChanges(BasicSeries<?,?> aSeries)
Returns:
a SampleSet with one less item than in the series where each sample is log(xi) with the first value omitted (it is assumed to be 1.0).

makeAssumingGeometricChanges

public static SampleSet makeAssumingGeometricChanges(PrimitiveSeries aSeries)

makeUsingDifferences

public static SampleSet makeUsingDifferences(BasicSeries<?,?> aSeries)
Returns:
a SampleSet with one less item than in the series where each sample is xi+1 - xi.

makeUsingDifferences

Returns:

makeUsingLogarithmicChanges

public static SampleSet makeUsingLogarithmicChanges(BasicSeries<?,?> aSeries)
Returns:
a SampleSet with one less item than in the series where each sample is log(xi+1) - log(xi) or log(xi+1 / xi).

makeUsingLogarithmicChanges

public static SampleSet makeUsingLogarithmicChanges(PrimitiveSeries aSeries)
Returns:
a SampleSet with one less item than in the series where each sample is log(xi+1) - log(xi) or log(xi+1 / xi).

makeUsingQuotients

public static SampleSet makeUsingQuotients(BasicSeries<?,?> aSeries)
Returns:
a SampleSet with one less item than in the series where each sample is xi+1 / xi.

getSumOfSquares

public double getSumOfSquares()

"Sum of squares is a concept that permeates much of inferential statistics and descriptive statistics. More properly, it is "the sum of the squared deviations". Mathematically, it is an unscaled, or unadjusted measure of dispersion (also called variability). When scaled for the number of degrees of freedom, it estimates the variance, or spread of the observations about their mean value."

Wikipedia
